alert.note: Alert for Briscoe; Childress; Cottle; Floyd; Hall; Motley (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 31 at 10:50PM CDT until June 01 at 12:15AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1215 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR NORTHERN COTTLE, NORTHEASTERN FLOYD, NORTHERN MOTLEY, SOUTHEASTERN BRISCOE, SOUTHERN CHILDRESS AND SOUTHERN HALL COUNTIES... At 1050 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Turkey, Caprock Canyon State Park, Quitaque, Northfield, Cee Vee, Tell, Flomot and Valley Schools. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Briscoe; Childress; Cottle; Floyd; Hall; Motley
